一个可扩展的模块化MUD服务器。

trans-unit.source: Clockwork includes a suite of unit tests in pytest format. To run the test suite you will first need to install pytest and the plugins we use (coverage, flake8, timeout). To install all of the test suite dependencies, run:
trans-unit.target: Clockwork includes a suite of unit tests in pytest format. To run the test suite you will first need to install pytest and the plugins we use (coverage, flake8, timeout). To install all of the test suite dependencies, run:

trans-unit.source: Clockwork is a pure-Python MUD server designed with modularity and ease of development in mind.
trans-unit.target: Clockwork是一个纯Python的MUD服务器,设计时考虑到了模块化和开发的便利性。

trans-unit.source: Clockwork requires a running Redis server and the redis-py bindings package for messages, and bcrypt for password hashing (and bcrypt in turn requires libffi). It also makes use of miniboa-py3, a Python 3 port of miniboa, which is a tiny, asynchronous Telnet server. Our modified copy of miniboa is included in
trans-unit.target: Clockwork requires a running Redis server and the redis-py bindings package for messages, and bcrypt for password hashing (and bcrypt in turn requires libffi). It also makes use of miniboa-py3, a Python 3 port of miniboa, which is a tiny, asynchronous Telnet server. Our modified copy of miniboa is included in

trans-unit.source: Clockwork runs on Python 3.4 and is as yet untested on any later versions. There are currently no plans to support earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Clockwork runs on Python 3.4 and is as yet untested on any later versions. There are currently no plans to support earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Clockwork uses the MIT license. See the license file for more details.
trans-unit.target: Clockwork uses the MIT license. See the license file for more details.

trans-unit.source: This isn’t a viable MUD server yet. There’s account creation, basic character creation, rooms, talking, and walking around, but that’s about it. There are also no permission controls on admin commands yet, so anyone can do whatever they want (which is good because there is no concept of an admin yet).
trans-unit.target: This isn’t a viable MUD server yet. There’s account creation, basic character creation, rooms, talking, and walking around, but that’s about it. There are also no permission controls on admin commands yet, so anyone can do whatever they want (which is good because there is no concept of an admin yet).

trans-unit.source: command was broken with the recent changes to client/protocol serving (the server reloads, but any connected clients will get dumped into a limbo state of disconnected I/O), but it should be fixed in the next minor version.
